```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
x = 1:9
n = length(x)
f = sample(20:80,n)*sample(c(-1,1),n,T)
a = sample(4:6,1)
c = sample(1:3,1)

ans = f[a+c]

```

Question
========

Function $f$ is defined by the table below:

```{r,echo=F,warning=F}
library(kableExtra)
df = data.frame(x,f)
colnames(df) = c("$x$","$f(x)$")
kable_styling(kable(df),bootstrap_options = "bordered",full_width = F)
```

Let $a=`r a`$. 

* Evaluate $f(a+`r c`)$.


Solution
========

You can substitute $a=`r a`$ into the expression.
$$f(`r a`+`r c`)=~?$$
Simplify the argument.
$$f(`r a+c`)=~?$$
Use the table.
$$f(`r a+c`)~=~`r ans`$$

Meta-information
============
extype: num
exsolution: `r ans`
